title.rendered: “Ask Me Anything”: Attend Open Sessions with Career Counselors

content.rendered:
To say a lot has changed in the last few weeks is an understatement. You are probably wondering how the current news will affect your ability to find and secure your next internship or job—or even when you’ll be returning to campus. 

Handshake wants to help with some of this uncertainty by hosting a series of open “Ask Me Anything” (AMA) sessions with career counselors.

Curious about how to prepare for an interview? Wondering how to approach an employer virtually? Thinking about how to shift your search tactics? Career counselors from a variety of schools—the University of California San Diego, Northern Arizona University, The University of Texas at Austin, and more—will each host a daily, hour-long session (on the same virtual meeting link) where you can ask them any questions about your job or internship search. 

You are welcome to attend even if you don’t have a specific question. You can just drop in and listen for a little extra help if you need it! 

The AMA sessions will take place every weekday from April 1 – April 17 at Noon PST/3pm EST.  

You don’t have to register, just click this link at Noon PST/3pm EST to join our standing, open session.

excerpt.rendered: Get virtual advice from career counselors across the country.
